articles.title: Industry agreement to end threat of strikes in Finland, for now
articles.description: Finland's key industrial employers' group reached a deal with labour unions on Friday over pay rises and working conditions, alleviating the immediate threat of more wide-spread strikes after five months of talks.
articles.content:
HELSINKI (Reuters) - Finland’s key industrial employers’ group reached a deal with labour unions on Friday over pay rises and working conditions, alleviating the immediate threat of more wide-spread strikes after five months of talks.

articles.title: Lebanon's president hopes government will be formed next week: statement
articles.description: Lebanese President Michel Aoun said in a statement on Friday that he hoped a new government would be formed next week.
articles.content:
CAIRO (Reuters) - Lebanese President Michel Aoun said in a statement on Friday that he hoped a new government would be formed next week.

articles.title: Turkey says killing of Soleimani to fuel instability
articles.description: The U.S. air strike in Baghdad which killed Iranian Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani will increase insecurity and instability in the region, the Turkish Foreign Ministry said on Friday.
articles.content:
ISTANBUL (Reuters) - The U.S. air strike in Baghdad which killed Iranian Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani will increase insecurity and instability in the region, the Turkish Foreign Ministry said on Friday.

articles.title: UPDATE 1-Brazil's Braskem takes 2.7 bln reais charge for salt mining project
articles.description: Brazil petrochemical producer Braskem SA has agreed to a 2.7 billion reais ($667 million) settlement with federal and state authorities in the northeastern state of Alagoas to cover damage caused by a mining project in the area.

articles.title: Price surge dents physical gold demand; India flips to discount
articles.description: Physical gold buying was subdued in major Asian hubs this week as a rally in prices dampened demand for the metal ahead of the Chinese New Year.
articles.content:
BENGALURU/MUMBAI (Reuters) - Physical gold buying was subdued in major Asian hubs this week as a rally in prices dampened demand for the metal ahead of the Chinese New Year.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Soleimani attack site cleared as Iraqis celebrate his death
articles.description: Workers in Baghdad began clearing debris near the city's international airport following an air strike that killed Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis on Friday.
articles.content:
Posted 
Workers in Baghdad began clearing debris near the city's international airport following an air strike that killed Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis on Friday.

articles.title: Eight migrants die after boat sinks off western Turkey: interior ministry
